caption:
This photograph captures a large industrial facility, likely a chemical plant, dominated by several large metal storage tanks and complex structures with pipes and frameworks. In the foreground, a chain-link fence is visible, presumably delineating the boundaries of the facility. Prominently displayed in front of this fence is a sign with the logo and text "GENERAL TIRE CHEMICAL DIVISION HOME OF GENSYN RUBBER Odessa TEXAS", indicating the company and location of the plant.

The background shows a clear blue sky, signifying a day with good visibility and no apparent pollution or smog. The plant itself has a utilitarian appearance, typical of industrial complexes, with no decorative elements, focused purely on functionality. The area around the plant appears to be a flat open space which suggests a location that could be semi-rural or on the outskirts of urban areas. Key features like safety ladders, railings, and external piping on the tanks speak to the industrial nature of the operation taking place.
title: Cooling towers and settling tanks for removal of effluents from the water used by this general tire chemical plant are partially financed by the government.  Mr.  Wallace, plant manager questions the effectiveness of the process
